pageContext.description: This celt is very slightly curved near edge.
pageContext.surface: fairly smooth, slight encrustment, traces of light coloured earth all over the surface
pageContext.other: Width: edge 111; butt 67,  Thickness 7.5; 15; 9,  Weight: 871.77 gms
pageContext.associations: Found with over 400 other flat celts and a number of this silver ornament, by two native boys in a space about a yard square and four feet deep (about midway between Nagpur and Jabalpur) 21st Jany 1870
pageContext.publications: British Museum Guide to BA, page 67, Plate VII
pageContext.collection: Brighton Museum, pres. by Col. Alfred Bloomfield, Req. 687
